When I first bought this game i didn't like it because I didn't really understand it and waiting time was way up for killer, but about a year later I stated playing it again and I've had so much fun, I learned how perks work and that Ash ducks now. + with dedicated servers wait times are decreased.   
So if you are a struggling killer/survivor just know it takes major practice but  no hook camps or t-bagging pallets that's rude.
It has its problems. Lots of them. But its a good game if you know what you're doing.

Good sense of progression easy to pick up. Plenty to do without buying DLC. Very reasonable price. Queues for killer can be long but otherwise very solid game.

É aquela coisa, o jogo não é muito acolhedor para novos jogadores, o que faz muita gente a desenvolver um comportamento tóxico em seu jeito de jogar. As possibilidades de gameplay que o jogo anuncia ser possível não condizem com o que o jogo de fato oferece, ou seja, o jogo é desbalanceado até mesmo para a proposta da assimetria entre os jogadores. Isso vale tanto para categoria de assassino ou de sobrevivente. Não é a toa que a comunidade sobrevive somente em pequenos grupo. A empresa desenvolvedora, até o momento (2019), só se preocupa em chamar a atenção de novos jogadores e de agradar a comunidade por meio de lançamentos e licenciamentos de itens pagos. Mudanças no gameplay ou Game Design são pequenas, e só acontecem depois de muito barulho e confusão que desgasta (e muito!) a comunidade de jogadores.  Prepare-se para gastar muito dinheiro, bater muita boca e se divertir eventualmente.

P.S. de 2020: A fenda é uma bosta
divertido e assustador ótimo para jogar com amigos

So I came back to play after a two year break and I wasn't able to find a game as killer (waited for 20~ minutes) and it took me a long time (15~ minutes) to get a game as a survivor. Yet, it is the same god damn thing as it was two years ago, namely, the killer camping whoever he catches until the survivor suicides, the three survivors not on the hook is standing near the hook looking at the hooked survivor until he is dead rather than rushing gens. Coming back from a two year break, of course I was the first one to go on the hook. Are you seriously telling me I spent 35 minutes in queue to play a 5-7 minute game where I get camped as soon as I go on the hook? Screw that. Fix your queues, I'd rather play against rank 1 survivors/killers with fast queues.

"I think we've done a pretty good job so far." - The devs

good game but unfortunately i dont have friends :)
Killer is more fun than survivor. It's true, not just my opinion I swear

I find this game to be a very unique really fun game. Its not like Friday the 13th like everyone says it is but its something different. Its one of those games you can put hundreds of hours into and not get bored, still have more to achieve, and still be confused at how bad survivors can be. The devs also really interact with the community on their streams and the addition of The Oni I feel has really brought in some weird variety that this game really needed. I mean a killer similar to another killer but is still really different, its great!(I am now realizing that you guys probably don't get this joke because you don't have the game......) My only problem I have with this game is the fact that you have to buy most of the characters, but they give you the most fun and the best characters for free! Anyway, I recommend this game and as you can see I have many hours on this game that I don't regret at all. I am also realizing that this review is better than most summaries I have ever written for school or work...... that's just how good this game is

This game is a co-op survival game that doesn't really need too much cooperation. The game gets grindy pretty quickly, but it is still enjoyable. The biggest issue though, is the times it takes to find a match as a killer when you are just starting out. When everyone is working together though, this game really shines.

The game is great but it's repetitive. You repair 5 generators find an exit and escape. If you're a killer you have to put survivors on meathooks 3 times to kill them, 2 times in order to kill them by your hand with a mori. It's like that every match and it gets boring after a while. But other than that the game is great it has a selection of characters from movies or other games like Nemesis or Michael Myers. I dont suggest buying Freddy through since he has been a waste of money since his power rework.

Frustrante e injusto, no tienen ganas de hacer el juego balanceado ya que es mejor sacar DLC's para sacarle plata a la gente en lugar de hacerlo justo para jugar, los killer en su mayoria te hacen Oneshot, y si no es eso te hacen tunneling y no hay nada que puedas hacer al respecto porque los survivors corren la mitad de lo que corre un killer lo cual hace casi nula la posibilidad de que te escapes, si te toca un killer que te campea en el gancho (70% de los killer) tampoco podes hacer nada porque la probabilidad de salvarte solo es del 3% (??????).
Jugar survivor es totalmente frustrante por todos esos motivos, o te toca un killer noob que no sabe jugar o no te escapas, porque cualquier persona que tenga un minimo manejo de un killer te va a ganar la partida sin siquiera esfuerzo, mientras que dedicarle 30hs a jugar survivor no te recompensa en nada, porque sigue siendo igual que al principio solo con algunas ventajas, que son totalmente inutiles comparadas con los kits que tienen los killers.
En fin, si te gusta la frustracion, el enojo, una comunidad que no te va a ayudar a ganar la partida y la sensacion de que no podes hacer nada en comparacion a lo que son los killer, compralo, sino ni te gastes.
Sin embargo tiene ese algo que te atrapa y te hace volver a intentarlo, enojarte, desinstalar, calmarte, volver a instalar, y  asi en un bucle xD

Amazing game, but also amazingly buggy. We know that the art department is different than the coding department, but it seems that the company is more focused on selling content than releasing quality of life updates. The game is still fun to play; but also needs dire quality of life updates that would need to take precedence over others.. Like there's literally no point in rank right now because there's no rewards; and there's no reason for rank reset once a month if there's no rewards. You have R1's playing with 2-3 ranks higher than them so playing the game on rank reset day is just like slapping yourself for the entirety that you play.

i highly recommend this game, feels unfair at times but highly addictive, if you have money to spare i would say pick this game up and have fun with friends, i now have over 700 hours and i still recommend this game

This game is like meth. You start out slow enjoying your time. You tell yourself yes I like meth but it isn't something I would get addicted too. Next thing you know your selling your tv so you can buy in game cosmetics so you can die in style. You tell yourself I can quit anytime I want. You get hit through pallets and windows but when you play killer everybody has perfect pathing and can loop you till you hit bloodlust 3. You tell yourself that's it no more meth, but come Sunday you are riding the blue pony all the way to doing 3 gens solo then dying to no ed while your team leaves.

overall I rate this game 4/5 meth rocks. It has it's flaws but it feels personal to you.
Un buen juego para disfrutar con tus amigos pero actualmente le falta mucho.

Dead By Daylight is truly a one of a kind game.  Many have tried, but few have succeeded in replication.  For those who are on the edge of buying, but don't want to read through to find all the nuances and caveats only for a tldr at the end, here is my take on the game, and how I feel most reviews should go:  If you want to murder people as strange, bizarre and horrid creatures that show the failings of humanity (plus a few licensed killers) than this game is for you.  If you want to desperately try and escape said monsters only to repeat the cycle endlessly, this game is for you. 

This game is so creative in so many ways.  Its story; while patchy and sometimes bland, is amazing, weaving you into a world controlled by an elder god puppeteer who feeds off hope.  Its Game play is hit or miss, and the game does suffer from balancing issues, often making one perk too strong and focusing its effort on that, whilst terrible and unusable perks sit on the shelf.  However I believe that all deserve forgiveness and so as much as I get frustrated, I am willing to throw the Devs a bone.  On a more positive note, the games sound, visual, and lore department are stellar, and they continue to pump out unique and astonishing killers as well as introspective survivors.  Take the next chapter:  A Binding of Kin,  where in the killer is actually two conjoined twins from 17th century France.  If that alone does not sell you on this game, think of all the games that try to imitate the horror genre, and what they have?  Creepy white slasher number 14?  How about a mud witch that marks the ground with runes that cause fake versions of herself to explode from the ground.   Dead by daylight does have some bland killers, but the newest killers are really challenging the mold.

If you do want to buy this game, do so.  If you are wondering if you should wait for a sale, do not wait, buy it now.  It is an amazing game and you should very well spend your money.  While I sometimes disagree with the Devs, this game truly is one of a kind and I have no doubt it will go down as one of the best games ever made, I see it alongside games such as TF2, and titanfall 2.  Others and others recognized as the greatest games of the age

This game has an addictive quality to it, IF you can get past your ego... I LOVE the updates and the way you can commit to getting better and proving how practice makes perfect. Comparatively if you think all of your friends will commit to this task of getting better and not quitting because of frustration you would be wrong. Get good at the game and play competitively with friends you meet in the game... want to have fun with your friends? be prepared to level your skill down to make sure they have fun. Overall I love the game, it has moments where you get SOOOO frustrated at someone who face-camped you or any of the other cheesy experience breaking moments, but you leave that game and start again! You'd be silly not to try the game though.
